image.altText: A woman holds bills in front of her and looks stern

props.synopsis:
Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.


Â

title.children: $5 milk and $90 rent rises: NT cost of living pushing families into housing stress

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: A witness at an inquest into the death of Alice Springs boy Mitchell Thomas has denied doctoring an electrical report in the wake of a fatal house fire.

title.children: Electrician denies 'witness contamination' in child house fire inquest

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. A game demo can be seen on his computer in the background.

props.synopsis: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

title.children: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry

image.altText: A man in a button-up shirt and tie walking out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of physically assaulting four students, including choking a pupil and dragging students by the ear.

title.children: Former principal guilty on four counts of physically assaulting students

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining transgender women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.Â

title.children: Advocates condemn NT leader's comments on trans women in female prisons

image.altText: Minister for Indigenous Australians Malarndirri McCarthy stands at a lecturn during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Demands our country's full attention': Funding threat on Closing the Gap

image.altText: Soldiers in jumpsuits stand in formation on tarmac in front of a large reconnaisance plane.

props.synopsis: Australia's most sophisticated military surveillance plane was deployed 45 times next to Ukraine in the last three months as part of NATO efforts to monitor Russian activity.

title.children: Australian spy plane deployed 45 times during mission to help Ukraine

image.altText: People on the streets of Singapore

props.synopsis: Businesses in Singapore â one of the most trade-exposed economies in the world â have been watching the fallout from Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs with apprehension.

title.children: Singapore was hit with a 10pc US tariff but the fallout reaches further

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".Â

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: Samples of rare earth minerals from left, Cerium oxide, Bastnasite, Neodymium oxide and Lanthanum carbonate

props.synopsis: As rare earths re-emerge as a central battleground in the US-China trade war, Australian companies are already striking deals to supply America. A policy expert says talks at the White House next week could secure a national agreement.

title.children: Australian rare earths miners soar on American interest

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt and jeans standing at the trunk of a big tree in a green rainforest.

props.synopsis: Climate change is killing trees faster than they can be replaced leading to greater carbon emissions, according to a new study.

title.children: Australia's tropical trees emit more carbon than they absorb: study

image.altText: a tarmac worker helps guide a poseidon plane

props.synopsis: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

title.children: Historic squadron rebooted ahead of Albanese-Trump meeting

image.altText: an Australian flag pictured on the uniform of Australian Army personnel.

props.synopsis: One person suffers critical injuries and two others are injured in a vehicle rollover involving defence personnel in Townsville

title.children: Rollover involving ADF personnel leaves one with 'life-threatening' injuries

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: New polling shows most Australians want to stick with the US alliance, despite holding overwhelmingly negative views towards the Trump administration and harbouring deep worries about the erosion of American democracy.

title.children: Aussies stick with US in new poll despite disliking Trump

image.altText: Tom Petroro points a finger at Hawthorn list bosses in a corporate suite

props.synopsis: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever â with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

title.children: Five quick hits: Agents fume and clubs feud as AFL trade period ends in drama

image.altText: Nathan studying at a desk, with papers and a laptop. He is wearing a red shirt.

props.synopsis: Sitting year 12 exams is a big achievement for anyone, but more so for Nathan Barbara having undergone a heart transplant less than a year ago.

title.children: From heart transplant to HSC: One year 12 student's challenging journey

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman wears a dark sleeveless top on a tennis court.

props.synopsis: Australian duo Ajla TomljanoviÄ and James Duckworth reach the quarterfinals at their respective events in China and Kazakhstan.

title.children: TomljanoviÄ, Duckworth continue late-season surge in Asia

image.altText: Good generic pic of gold pour

props.synopsis: The Australian share market looks set to build on yesterday's strong rise, while gold prices continue to power to fresh record highs.Â Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: More ASX gains likely as gold's record run continues

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA governor describes interest rates as 'marginally tight'
'There's fear out there' but stocks rise further alongside gold

image.altText: An aerial view of dry, arid ground with dirt tracks where four-year-old Gus went missing

props.synopsis: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say.

title.children: Search for Gus expected to resume this morning in hot, windy conditions

image.altText: A drawing of an unhappy person with tangled thoughts floating from their mind.

props.synopsis: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

title.children: Australian diagnoses are 'on the rise', but what does ADHD actually mean?

image.altText: An insect with its wings extended sits atop a grain of rice

props.synopsis: Extreme close-ups of rice weevil, pollen in a spider's web and a geometer moth laying eggs are among this year's Nikon Small World competition entries from thousands of scientists and artists across the globe. Here are the judges' favourites.Â

title.children: Photomicroscopy competition's top 15 images capture tiniest signs of life

image.altText: A model of a rock shelter, with a small model person placed adjacent for scale

props.synopsis: A full-scale replica of the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, destroyed by mining company Rio Tinto, will be built over the remains of the original in Western Australia's north.

title.children: Inside the plan to rebuild Juukan Gorge rock shelter destroyed by Rio Tinto

image.altText: Fossil bones arranged in the shape of two hands.

props.synopsis: The first set of ancient hand fossils from an ape-like cousin of humans discovered in Kenya suggest a number of species were capable of making tools 1.5 million years ago.Â

title.children: Archaeologists discover 1.5-million-year-old hand fossils in Kenya

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: Ukraine implements emergency power cuts across the country amid a relentless drone assault on the country's power grid.

title.children: US vows to 'impose costs on Russia' if Ukraine war continues

image.altText: A hand touching fake grass

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council says microplastics and chemicals from artificial lawns can contaminate stormwater.

title.children: This NSW council wants to ban fake grass and the ACT could follow suit

image.altText: Smiling girl with I Voted sticker

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Hume Council will see the city's first-ever democratically elected youth mayor take office.

title.children: In Melbourne's north, a council for young people is taking shape

image.altText: A woman in front of her home.

props.synopsis: A year since the freak hailstorm that devastated the Victorian town of Casterton, Kim Jeffrey marked the anniversary the same way she has spent most of 2025 â living in a caravan in her driveway.

title.children: One year on, hailstorm victims still waiting to go home

image.altText: Calvary St Luke's Hospital sign.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian healthcare experts are calling for assurances about the future of a private hospital in Launceston in the wake of a costly infrastructure failure.Â

title.children: Private hospital's future under scrutiny after major infrastructure failure

image.altText: Vladimir Putin shakes hands with Ahmed al-Sharaa.

props.synopsis: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa has told Russian President Vladimir Putin he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.

title.children: Syrian president to honour past deals with Russia, ask for Assad to be handed over

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The ABC understands that a recent safety assessment found the interim berth would need two additional bollards for the ship to dock there at a cost of $2 million, an option which may not go ahead.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship unable to dock at interim berth at Point Henry in Geelong

image.altText: Headshot of a bald man holding a large beer with his fist curled.

props.synopsis: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

title.children: 'Had better days': UK social media star facing deportation from Perth

image.altText: Indonesian police stand with three suspects of a murder in front of press

props.synopsis: Indonesian police allege Zivan Radmanovic was killed when two Australian men stormed the villa, shooting him.Â

title.children: Three Australian men could face death penalty after alleged murder in Bali

image.altText: A military commander with a short back and sides haircut speaking in a conference room.

props.synopsis: Colonel Michael Randrianirina led a rebellion by soldiers that ousted President Andry Rajoelina after weeks of youth-led protests against the government.

title.children: Madagascar military leader says he is 'taking the position of president'
